doc.after: Jerusalem is home to several prestigious universities offering courses in Hebrew, Arabic and English. Founded in 1925, the Hebrew University of Jerusalem has been ranked among the top 100 schools in the world.[358] The Board of Governors has included such prominent Jewish intellectuals as Albert Einstein and Sigmund Freud.[166] The university has produced several Nobel laureates; recent winners associated with Hebrew University include Avram Hershko,[359] David Gross,[360] and Daniel Kahneman.[361] One of the university's major assets is the Jewish National and University Library, which houses over five million books.[362] The library opened in 1892, over three decades before the university was established, and is one of the world's largest repositories of books on Jewish subjects. Today it is both the central library of the university and the national library of Israel.[363] The Hebrew University operates three campuses in Jerusalem, on Mount Scopus, on Giv'at Ram and a medical campus at the Hadassah Ein Kerem hospital. the Academy of the Hebrew Language are located in the Hebrew university in Givat Ram and the Israel Academy of Sciences and Humanities located near the Presidents house.
